title: Add Admin Dashboard Settings modal to store Gemini API key in localStorage

requirements.text: Add a new, visually distinct button labeled "‚öôÔ∏è Settings" to the Admin Dashboard main action area (the same grid/list area where the existing admin actions like "Job Posts" and "üì¢ Manage Quiz" are accessed). The button must use a grey/black styling so it is clearly different from the other admin action buttons.

quotes: Inside the Admin Dashboard grid (where 'Job Posts' and 'Manage Quiz' buttons are), add a new button labeled '‚öôÔ∏è Settings'. Make it distinct (e.g., Grey or Black color).

acceptanceCriteria: Admin Dashboard shows a new button labeled "‚öôÔ∏è Settings" alongside the existing admin action entries.
The "‚öôÔ∏è Settings" button has grey/black styling distinct from the other buttons/tabs.
Clicking the button triggers opening the Settings popup/modal (see REQ-2).

requirements.text: Implement a Settings modal (popup) in the Admin Dashboard that opens when the "‚öôÔ∏è Settings" button is clicked. The modal must contain a simple form with: (1) a labeled password input field with label text "Gemini API Key" (input type=password so the value is hidden), and (2) a button labeled "Save Settings".

quotes: When I click the 'Settings' button, open a simple popup form. Input Field: Label it 'Gemini API Key'. Make it a password field (dots) so the key is hidden. Save Button: Add a 'Save Settings' button.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "‚öôÔ∏è Settings" opens a modal dialog.
Modal contains a form field labeled "Gemini API Key" and the input uses password masking.
Modal contains a primary action button labeled "Save Settings".
If a value already exists in localStorage under "gemini_api_key", the field is prefilled with that value when opening the modal.

requirements.text: When the user clicks "Save Settings" in the Admin Dashboard Settings modal, store the entered API key value (trimmed) in browser Local Storage under the key "gemini_api_key". After saving, show a success message exactly: "API Key Saved Successfully! ‚úÖ".

quotes: When I click 'Save', store the Key in Local Storage as gemini_api_key. Show a message: 'API Key Saved Successfully! ‚úÖ'. This key will be used by the Chatbot.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Save Settings" writes the trimmed API key to localStorage key "gemini_api_key".
A visible success notification/message appears with exact text: "API Key Saved Successfully! ‚úÖ".
After saving, reopening the Settings modal shows the saved key value still present (read back from localStorage).
No backend changes are required for saving; it is purely localStorage-based.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (shadcn components are read-only and must be composed).
Do not modify frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx (immutable paths).
Persist the API key only in browser localStorage under the exact key name "gemini_api_key".
nonGoals: Do not store the Gemini API key in the Motoko backend canister or any server-side storage.
Do not add third-party authentication or external secret management.
Do not change the chatbot prompt/content behavior beyond ensuring it can read the key from localStorage (it already uses "gemini_api_key").
